channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How U.S. sanctions played into the protests in IRan
item.description: The protests in Iran have been about human rights, corruption, freedom — but they were sparked by economic hardship, caused in part by U.S. sanctions. How did they play into the events in Iran?
item.content:encoded: The protests in Iran have been about human rights, corruption, freedom — but they were sparked by economic hardship, caused in part by U.S. sanctions. How did they play into the events in Iran?
item.dc:creator: Mary Childs

item.title: Germany's far right political party, the AFD, is at the Munich Security Conference
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly and Correspondent Rob Schmitz discuss Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, at to the Munich Security Conference.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly and Correspondent Rob Schmitz discuss Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, at to the Munich Security Conference.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: For the first time, lawmakers are reviewing unredacted copies of the Epstein files
item.description: Lawmakers are just beginning to review unredacted versions of the Epstein files but those who have read them say the system is complicated and insufficient.
item.content:encoded: Lawmakers are just beginning to review unredacted versions of the Epstein files but those who have read them say the system is complicated and insufficient.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: An effort in Congress to restrain immigration enforcement tactics is flailing (again)
item.description: A bipartisan effort in Congress to restrain immigration enforcement tactics is flailing. It wouldn't be the first time recently that lawmakers pledged to find consensus, only for negotiations to fail.
item.content:encoded: A bipartisan effort in Congress to restrain immigration enforcement tactics is flailing. It wouldn't be the first time recently that lawmakers pledged to find consensus, only for negotiations to fail.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: NATO members have launched a new Arctic initiative
item.description: NATO members have launched a new Arctic initiative after President Trump's threats to take over Greenland.
item.content:encoded: NATO members have launched a new Arctic initiative after President Trump's threats to take over Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: Ice boating on the Chesapeake
item.description: The recent deep freeze across much of the U.S. has created the best opportunity in decades to sail ice boats across frozen bays and rivers — including Chesapeake Bay.
item.content:encoded: The recent deep freeze across much of the U.S. has created the best opportunity in decades to sail ice boats across frozen bays and rivers — including Chesapeake Bay.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: What will the cities of tomorrow look like? These middle schoolers have thoughts
item.description: At the Illinois gathering of the Future City competition, 16 middle school teams presented their concepts for cutting-edge cities.
item.content:encoded: At the Illinois gathering of the Future City competition, 16 middle school teams presented their concepts for cutting-edge cities.
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: Ghanian musician Ebo Taylor, a pioneer in the world of modern highlife music, has died
item.description: This week the Ghanian musician Ebo Taylor died at 90 years old. While he was not well known in the U.S. he was a star in Africa, and a defining force in highlife music.
item.content:encoded: This week the Ghanian musician Ebo Taylor died at 90 years old. While he was not well known in the U.S. he was a star in Africa, and a defining force in highlife music.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Iranian exiles in Turkey scramble to find news from home
item.description: Iranians living in Turkey are hearing chilling stories from relatives at home — and receiving death threats themselves.
item.content:encoded: Iranians living in Turkey are hearing chilling stories from relatives at home — and receiving death threats themselves.
item.dc:creator: Durrie Bouscaren

item.title: Mayor says lack of communication created concern and alarm in El Paso
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with El Paso Mayor Renard Johnson about the FAA's temporary closure of airspace over the city, and how it was communicated to city leaders.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with El Paso Mayor Renard Johnson about the FAA's temporary closure of airspace over the city, and how it was communicated to city leaders.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith
